Utterance: Hi! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last conversation?
Hi Ellie! I’ve been okay, just keeping busy with work and the kids.
It sounds like you’ve been juggling a lot! How did the quality time with your son go?
It went really well! We had a fun day at the park, and I tried to focus on being present with him.
That’s wonderful to hear! How did he respond to the time you spent together?
He seemed really happy. We played games and just talked. It felt good to connect.
That’s fantastic! It sounds like you’re building a strong bond. Have you noticed any changes in his behavior since you’ve been spending more time together?
He seems more open to talking about his feelings, which is nice.
That’s a positive development! Encouraging open communication can really help him feel secure. Is there anything else you’d like to explore in your relationship with him?
I want to make sure he feels comfortable coming to me with anything. I don’t want him to feel like he has to hide things.
That’s an important goal. What strategies do you think could help create that safe space for him?
I think just being non-judgmental and really listening when he talks would help.
That’s a great approach! Modeling that behavior can encourage him to be more open. Now, how have the classes been going for you?
They’re still challenging, but I’m managing. I’ve been sticking to my study schedule.
That’s great to hear! It sounds like you’re finding a rhythm. What aspects of the classes have you enjoyed the most?
I really like the leadership training. It’s giving me a lot of useful tools.
That’s excellent! Leadership skills are essential, especially as you aim for that supervisory position. Have you thought about how you can apply what you’re learning at work?
Yes, I’ve started to take on more responsibilities at work, which is exciting.
That’s a fantastic way to put your skills into practice! How does it feel to step into those responsibilities?
It feels empowering. I’m starting to see myself in that role.
That’s a significant shift! It’s wonderful to see you embracing your potential. Now, how has your sleep been lately?
It’s been pretty good! I’ve been sticking to my routine, and the stretching helps.
That’s wonderful! It seems like you’re making great progress. Have you noticed any changes in how you feel during the day?
I have more energy, and I’m not as easily irritated.
That’s a positive outcome! It’s amazing what a good night’s sleep can do. Is there anything else you’d like to work on today?
I’ve been thinking about my relationship with my oldest daughter again. I still want to help her, but I’m not sure how.
It’s great that you want to support her. What specific challenges are you facing in that relationship?
I just feel like she’s struggling, and I want to guide her without pushing her away.
That’s a delicate balance. Have you considered having an open conversation with her about how she’s feeling?
I think I could do that. Maybe if I approach it gently, she’ll be more receptive.
That sounds like a good plan. Creating a safe space for her to express herself is key. How do you feel about setting a time to talk with her this week?
I’ll try to make that happen. I think it could be really helpful.
That’s a great step! I’m looking forward to hearing how that goes. Before we wrap up, is there anything else on your mind?
No, I think we covered a lot today. Thank you for your support.
You’re very welcome! I’m proud of the progress you’re making. Take care, and I’ll see you next time!
Bye, Ellie!
Goodbye!
